intro: Euphrasia slovaca subsp. pseudomontana, commonly known as the Slovak eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant features small, yellow-orange flowers with prominent dark veins, characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
